notes: NAMA refers to a set of policies and actions that countries undertake as part of a commitment to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The term recognizes that different countries may take different nationally appropriate action on the basis of equity and in accordance with common but differentiated responsibilities and respective capabilities. It also emphasizes financial assistance from developed countries to developing countries to reduce emissions.

groups.name: climate-change-mitigation
groups.title: Climate Change Mitigation
groups.description: If the global food supply is to keep pace with population growth and dietary changes, agricultural productivity must increase. Changes in agricultural practices can help the world not only to meet its targets for reducing greenhouse gas emissions but also to contribute to food security.

name: nationally-appropriate-mitigation-action-nama

organization.title: FAO
organization.description: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
organization.name: fao

title: Learning on Nationally Appropriate Mitigation Action (NAMA)

resources.description: The online Learning tool on NAMAs in the AFOLU sector has been designed for agriculture sectors experts  who want to understand more about the concept of NAMA and increase their capacity to contribute to national and global climate change mitigation goals.
resources.name: Learning tool on  NAMA in Agriculture, Forestry and Other Land Use (AFOLU) sector
Webinar on NAMA
resources.description: Webinar on Nationally Appropriate Mitigation Actions (NAMAs) , part of the Mitigation of Climate Change in Agriculture (MICCA) Programme. MICCA has put together a wide variety of learning materials, including over 30 online seminars and webinars, for technical audiences including concepts, policies, practices and techniques for climate change adaptation and mitigation in the agriculture sector; and the online learning tool on "Nationally Appropriate Mitigation Actions (NAMAs) in the agriculture, forestry and other land use (AFOLU) sector"
